title: Neftekamsk
text:
Neftekamsk (; ) is a <a href="types%20of%20inhabited%20localities%20in%20Russia">city</a> in the <a href="Republic%20of%20Bashkortostan">Republic of Bashkortostan</a>, <a href="Russia">Russia</a>, located in the northwest of the republic on the <a href="Kama%20River">Kama River</a>, from the republic's <a href="capital%20city">capital</a> <a href="Ufa">Ufa</a>. It is a large industrial and cultural center of the republic. Population: 
Etymology.
The city is named after the <a href="Kama%20River">Kama River</a> and <a href="petroleum">petroleum</a> (, "neft" in Russian).
Geography.
The city's territory borders with <a href="Krasnokamsky%20District">Krasnokamsky</a> and <a href="Yanaulsky%20District">Yanaulsky District</a>s of the republic. A road network connects the town to Ufa, <a href="Birsk">Birsk</a>, <a href="Yanaul">Yanaul</a>, <a href="Agidel">Agidel</a>, <a href="Oktyabrsky%2C%20Republic%20of%20Bashkortostan">Oktyabrsky</a>, <a href="Izhevsk">Izhevsk</a>, <a href="Perm%2C%20Russia">Perm</a>, and <a href="Kazan">Kazan</a>. The nearest railway station for long-distance trains is located in <a href="Amzya">Amzya</a>, away. There is a local train connecting Neftekamsk with Yanaul via Amzya. <a href="Neftekamsk%20Airport">Neftekamsk Airport</a> serves the city.
History.
It was founded in 1957 after the discovery of an oil field in <a href="Krasnokamsky%20District">Krasnokamsky District</a>. Town status was granted to it in 1963.
Administrative and municipal status.
Within the <a href="subdivisions%20of%20Russia%23Administrative%20divisions">framework of administrative divisions</a>, it is, together with seven rural localities, incorporated as the <a href="city%20of%20federal%20subject%20significance">city of republic significance</a> of Neftekamsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the <a href="administrative%20divisions%20of%20the%20Republic%20of%20Bashkortostan">districts</a>. As a <a href="subdivisions%20of%20Russia%23Municipal%20divisions">municipal division</a>, the city of republic significance of Neftekamsk is incorporated as Neftekamsk Urban Okrug.
Demographics.
The city ranks fourth in population in the republic after Ufa, <a href="Sterlitamak">Sterlitamak</a>, and <a href="Salavat%2C%20Russia">Salavat</a>.
Economy.
Principal place of business of the city <a href="Neftekamsk%20Automotive%20Plant">Neftekamsk Automotive Plant</a>, which is one of the major producers of passenger buses in Russia.
